intro: Notylia albida, commonly known as the white-flowered notylia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds. Notylia albida is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
